intro: Jobinia samuelssonii, commonly known as the Samuelson's jobinia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their diverse ecological roles. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many shrubs in its family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
